page.title: 03FARMING - FARM WORKERS
page.content: Machinery and modern technology have greatly reduced the number of people employed on the Home Farm. The Farm covers an area of 2350 acres. It has 8 tractors and 2 combines which are maintained by mechanics and the drivers on the Farm wherever possible. Training of the Farm Managers and workers takes place at college and on the Farm itself - where courses are set up as the need arises. Additional help is required at harvest time when contract workers are employed. A micro-computer at Chalkpit Farm and a mini-computer at the Estate Office keep farm accounts and records. They deal with both wages and the cash turnover of the Farm. Two part-time secretaries are employed in the Farm Office doing clerical work and the computer accounts.
